intro: Zuccarinia verbenacea, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family, which includes several ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly rough texture. Zuccarinia verbenacea is typically found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in warm, sunny environments.
